column4: so anyone that can help with the ubuntu install of apache or should i ask in #apache?
not sure why the error log is saying it cannot read an .htaccess file in my user directory.  I am not even sure why it is looking in my user directory ~/.htaccess
my vhost is correct, i have checked several times
but for some reason my install is seeking out an .htaccess in /home/jocrawfo/ which is nothing I setup
and I do not need MySQL installed just Apache
so marking by task is not what I need
Why is apache looking at your home directory, did you setup a vhost to look there? If so, then www-data needs to be able to read the directory, even if you don't have an .htaccess file there.
no i did not set my vhost to be there, my vhost is /home/jocrawfo/workspace/ovife/
Hm.. Then it shouldn't really care.  I think that #httpd might be able to help you more (thats the Apache support channel)
thanks i was not sure if they would support the ubuntu install as it is not typical :)
You can modify those from the bookmarks menu in any Nautilus window.
Please refrain from using lmgtfy links here.
Because thats not the purpose of this channel.
